# The `MemAlloc.h` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file defines counterparts of C library allocation functions defined in the namespace &#39;std&#39;. <a href="#details">More...</a>

This is an optimization pass for GlobalISel generic memory operations. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

This file defines counterparts of C library allocation functions defined in the namespace &#39;std&#39;.

The new allocation functions crash on allocation failure instead of returning null pointer.

<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Allocate a buffer of memory with the given size and alignment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// When the compiler supports aligned operator new, this will use it to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// handle even over-aligned allocations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// However, this doesn&#39;t make any attempt to leverage the fancier techniques</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// like posix&#95;memalign due to portability. It is mostly intended to allow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// compatibility with platforms that, after aligned allocation was added, use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// reduced default alignment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#acbae7c06e77fa64145cca176963b6863">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NONNULL</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a33bc304d1e6e184f3ffd9fa1620fd14c">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NOALIAS</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a69fae8413f8fd4cea02237fe8b0c00ed">allocate&#95;buffer</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Alignment);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Deallocate a buffer of memory with the given size and alignment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If supported, this will used the sized delete operator. Also if supported,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
